intro: Strombosiopsis sereinii, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that open at night. The plant has hairy, ovate leaves and produces capsule fruits containing numerous small seeds. Strombosiopsis sereinii thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in savanna and woodland habitats. Its nocturnal blooming habit attracts specific pollinators, such as moths, making it an important species in local ecosystems.
